channel.title: downtownTV.com presents Downtown Live
channel.description: Downtown Live is a new television show featuring a diverse group of talented performers, be they singers, humorists, dancers, legends or puppets. It is a true compendium of modern miscellania. Hosted by Edgar Oliver.
channel.itunes:author: downtownTV.com
channel.itunes:subtitle: Downtown Live
channel.itunes:summary: Downtown Live is a new television show featuring a diverse group of talented performers, be they singers, humorists, dancers, legends or puppets. It is a true compendium of modern miscellania. the show is hosted by Edgar Oliver, the distinguished off-off-off-off-off-Broadway playwright and actor, and stays true to its standards and its downtown roots. Downtown Live originated at Ace of Clubs in New York's NoHo, where it enjoyed a short, strenuous and successful season and continues to find unique and special performances at various downtown spots. The Downtown Live theme song 'Fun' is written by Carlton DeWoody and performed by Snowboots.

item.title: episode 26: baby jane dexter - everybody hurts
item.dc:creator: downtowntv
item.description: Tracks took its show outdoors for the first time on the main stage of the HOWL! festival in Tompkins Square Park in the Lower East Village and legendary artist, Baby Jane Dexter, had grown men weeping, hipsters riveted and every soul moved by her unforgettable rendition of the R.E.M. classic, 'Everybody Hurts'

item.title: episode 25: steve forbert's midsummer night's toast
item.dc:creator: downtowntv
item.description: another favorite of fans and critics alike, 'Steve Forbert's Midsummer Night's Toast', thrilled old and new fans that came to see him at his recent appearance at Joe's Pub.

item.title: episode 24: steve forbert - romeo's tune
item.dc:creator: downtowntv
item.description: Steve Forbert is a singer/songwriter whose talent and love of music continues to create songs for himself and others. Here is his recent performance at Joe's Pub in New York of 'Romeo's Tune', which was a hit some time back and is still a favorite of many.

item.title: episode 23: miz metro feat. crosby
item.dc:creator: downtowntv
item.description: Crosby joins Miz Metro in an affectionate duet at Sideshow: a Night of Singer/Songwriter Hip Hop that took place recently at the Knitting Factory.

item.title: episode 22: miz metro - place 2 be
item.dc:creator: downtowntv
item.description: Miz Metro performs 'Place 2 Be' at Sideshow: a Night of Singer/Songwriter Hip Hop at the Knitting Factory with her very special urban charms and talents.

item.title: episode 21: tippy - oh no
item.dc:creator: downtowntv
item.description: another performance from one of downtown's new favorites, Tippy, of 'Oh No' celebrates dancing and group joy in one of downtown's favorite spots, Plan B.

item.title: episode 20: tippy - you don't know me
item.dc:creator: downtowntv
item.description: Tippy is a Lower East Side hip hop artist whose independent spirit and talent are attracting attention from fans and critics alike and this performance from her last week's appearance at one of downtownTV.com's favorite boits, Plan B, is but the tippy of the iceberg.

item.title: episode 19: consider the sourse - keep your pimp hand strong
item.dc:creator: downtowntv
item.description: by popular demand, Downtown Live brings you another virtuoso performance by Consider The Source from Miz Metro's Urban Gypsy Circus at Clemente Soto Vélez Cultural Center set to the backdrop of Dr Robotto's visual wonders.

item.title: episode 18: flow
item.dc:creator: downtowntv
item.description: Flow (Rephstar, Pattydukes and Crosby) are joined by Alex Cowings and Michelle Mola in one of the first Flow performances from the Downtown Live show at the Ace of Clubs. Congrats to Pattydukes and Rephstar for winning the national latino hip-hop competition Cuervoton.

item.title: episode 17: bob dylan rolling thunder revue tribute
item.dc:creator: downtowntv
item.description:
this past weekend in an East Village club, Club Midway, took place an affectionate remembrance and revue of the fabled 1974 Rolling Thunder Revue, which the downtownTV.com founder enjoyed in 3 different cities in its original incarnation, and enjoyed once again this past weekend. an assortment of musical characters of the first order changed off as in the original and provided a thoroughly modern downtown take on that great event. be they harmonikatz, musically capable and affably able music industry-ites, a rolling good time was had by all.

there was some confusion about who performed Queen Jane Approximately so well and now we can say with certainty that it was Marc Philippe Eskenazi, a touring member of Albert Hammond, jr.'s group.

item.title: episode 16: consider the source
item.dc:creator: downtowntv
item.description: Downtown Live stopped by Miz Metro's Urban Gypsy Circus at Clemente Soto Vélez Cultural Center and captured the amazing musical virtuosity of Consider The Source complemented by the video wizardry of Dr Robotto.

item.title: episode 15: anjani featuring leonard cohen
item.dc:creator: downtowntv
item.description: part two of Downtown Live from that magical night at Joe's Pub features Leonard Cohen joining Anjani on 'Never Got to Love You', a song they co-wrote together, and Guy Singer's  'Whither Thou Goest'.

item.title: episode 14: leonard cohen presents anjani
item.dc:creator: downtowntv
item.description:
last week a very special night took place at Joe's Pub when Leonard Cohen introduced Anjani, whose new album Blue Alert he co-wrote and produced. this week's Downtown Live features his poetic grace in introducing Anjani who then performs one of Leonard's own songs "The Gypsy's Wife".
stay tuned for next  week's episode, in which Leonard Cohen joins Anjani in a rare and magical live musical encounter.

item.title: episode 13: junior brown
item.dc:creator: downtowntv
item.description: Downtown Live is happy to present this very special treat capturing the flavor of the instrumental and vocal magic of Junior Brown at Joe's Pub.

item.title: episode 12: the loser's lounge
item.dc:creator: downtowntv
item.description: downtownTV.com's roving camera in the night stopped by New York's finest music club, Joe's Pub, to enjoy the newest chapter in The Loser's Lounge, Joe McGinty's distinguished series of musical tributes, and captured this extraordinary performance of a Hall & Oates classic 'Every Time You Go Away" by Tricia Scotti with musical support by the distinguished Kustard Kings.
